# üç≠ Candy machine
[![SvelteIcon](https://img.shields.io/static/v1?label=&message=Svelte&color=black&style=flat&logo=svelte)](https://svelte.dev/) 
[![Solana](https://img.shields.io/static/v1?label=&message=Solana&color=black&style=flat&logo=data:image/png;base64,)](https://solana.com/) [![Metaplex](https://img.shields.io/static/v1?label=&message=Metaplex&color=black&style=flat&logo=data:image/jpeg;base64,)](https://www.metaplex.com/) [![JavaScript](https://img.shields.io/static/v1?label=&message=JavaScript&color=black&style=flat&logo=JavaScript)](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript)

The worlds first candy machine built on Svelte for Solana network. Inspired by [React sample](https://github.com/exiled-apes/candy-machine-mint) 

## ‚öôÔ∏è Install
Move to _frontend_ directory and install dependencies. __[pnpm](https://pnpm.io/)__ is recommended to use
```shell
$: cd ./frontend
$: pnpm i
```
Create candy machine using __Metaplex__. Read tutorial about __[Metaplex CLI](https://github.com/metaplex-foundation/metaplex/tree/master/js/packages/cli)__ & __[Detailed Docs](https://docs.metaplex.com/create-candy/introduction)__. Check out _cli_ output and _.cache/temp_ file to get right _IDs_

## üç¨ How To 
Create Candy Machine and connect it with frontend in a short

1. Clone the entire __[Metaplex](https://github.com/metaplex-foundation/metaplex)__ 
2. Go to _js/packages_
   ```shell
   $: cd js/packages
   ```
3. Install local dependencies and __[ts-node](https://typestrong.org/ts-node/)__
   ```shell
   $: npm install
   $: npm install -g typescript
   $: npm install -g ts-node
    ```
4. Check __[Token Metadata Standard](https://docs.metaplex.com/nft-standard)__ and create your own collection
5. Place all files of collection in _asset_ directory
6. Get your private key location (you must install [Solana CLI](https://docs.solana.com/cli) and create wallet before)
    ```shell
   $: solana config get 
    ```
7. Upload collection
    ```shell
   $: ts-node cli upload ./assets --env devnet -k <path/to/your/solana/key/id.json>
    ```
8. Create a new candy machine with price __5 sol__ per NFT
    ```shell
    $: ts-node cli create_candy_machine -k <path/to/your/solana/key/id.json> -p 5
    ```
   Copy and save candy machine ID, set it for __VITE_CANDY_MACHINE_ID__ variable in _.env.development_
9. Set drop date (Greenwich Mean Time)
   ```shell
   $: ts-node cli update_candy_machine -k <path/to/your/solana/key/id.json> -d "21 Nov 2021 17:00:00 GMT"
    ```
   You can also update the price, using _-k_ parameter
10. Copy config field from _.cache/devnet-temp_ and set it for __VITE_CANDY_MACHINE_ID__ variable in _.env.development_

## üöÄ Startup the app
Now you are ready to launch your Candy Machine 
```shell
   $: pnpm run dev
```
Go to __[Mint Page](http://localhost:3000/mint)__ and try it out
